common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Service and Sharing Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with the Pieces Copilot Service, encountering an 'Instance of 'fp'' error.  Additionally, sharing snippets via link or GitHub gist is failing on Windows.  The Pieces OS versions range from 11.0.4 to 12.1.1.  MacOS users are on 15.6 while the minimum supported is 12.0.0. Further investigation is needed into the 'fp' error and sharing functionality.

common_issues.title: Issues with Copying, Sharing, and Dragging Files in Pieces OS 12.1.1
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with copying code blocks (inline vs. inter-line discrepancies), sharing snippets via links or GitHub gists, and dragging files into the conversation context.  Additional issues include file choosing window behavior and file filtering limitations.  The issues appear specific to the Windows desktop application version 12.1.1.

related_issues.title: Copy python code block = copy message ? what a big mistake !!
related_issues.text: Copy python code block = copy message ? what a big mistake !! ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. 1. The 2nd pic below do not function properly: The description of this problem only requires one line equation, and inequality of graphics: - it should be: Copy copilot message ≠ Copy `inter-line code block` (floating) = Copy `inter-line code block` (fixed) - however: = ≠ - how could Copy `inter-line code block` (floating)= Copy `inter-line code block` (floating) ? absolute wrong. - it should be like: Copy `inter-line code block` (floating)= Copy `inter-line code block` (fixed) by design. 2. Copy improperly: if one copies `in-line code block` through ctrl+c (rather than the "copy button" provided alongside), it is very likely (coupled with double click) to paste it into " ￼ ". 3. Feature: Hopefully, the `in-line code block` can be partially copied (rather than merely allowing all copies) like the inter-line code block to improve efficiency. related_issues.title: CANNOT drag a file into CONVERSATION CONTEXT
related_issues.text:
CANNOT drag a file into CONVERSATION CONTEXT
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

1. CANNOT drag a file into CONVERSATION CONTEXT
2. the window for file choosing sometimes pops out back (not front)
3. filter rules only applies to certain files, for example, .jsonl is excluded

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b93e462c-b331-4887-aadc-8f663f4ce9e0

Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Investigate the root cause of the 'Instance of 'fp'' error affecting the Pieces Copilot Service.
Address the sharing functionality failures on Windows for link and GitHub gist sharing.
Review the copy/paste behavior for inline code blocks, especially the discrepancy between using Ctrl+c and the copy button.
Fix the drag-and-drop functionality for files into the conversation context on Windows.
Improve file-choosing window behavior and filtering limitations on Windows, specifically addressing the exclusion of .jsonl files.
Prioritize resolution of issues related to sharing snippets via link or GitHub gist on Windows.
Investigate and address the reported discrepancies in copying code blocks (inline vs. inter-line) on Windows.
